https://aw2.help/about/.body:
Our Mission
We are a community of Guild Wars 2 gamers with accessibility needs and creators that support them.
We aim to help accommodate a wide range of needs, from physical to cognitive. We provide a repository of builds and resources,
with the goal of allowing players to access more difficult content and comfortably contribute in group play.
Contributions
To get involved, any of the following is very helpful:

join the Accessibility Wars Too discord
check out the GitHub to help with code
share the Accessibility Wars website
test out builds and provide feedback (on discord)
submit new builds (on discord)

The Crew

berdandy - code/site/tools, discord, builds
scooby - builds
masel - builds
xellink - builds
xmidsummerdreams - discord
bunny - discord

... and various other contributors
https://aw2.help/about/.title: About Accessibility Wars Too

https://aw2.help/alternatives/.body:
We don't hold a monopoly on Accessible Builds here at Accessibility Wars. Here is a non-exhaustive list of some other places to find builds.
Note that the terminology can vary; many use the term LI (Low Intensity), where we simply use the term Accessible.
Additionally, many "standard" builds can function perfectly well in a Low Intensity way with minor modifications, such as camping a single weapon. That can open up some additional options after some experimentation.
For a player with accessibility needs, some of these builds may be unworkable, but some might fit well.

Build Sites
MukLuk LI Builds
Mukluk has a lot of varied content, but has a dedicated LI tag
Hardstuck
Hardstuck has posted a few accessible builds, mostly found in the Open World section. Use their difficulty selector to filter builds.
GuildJen
Builds for all game modes. Builds marked with a green star are on the simpler side, and are generally more accessible. This is
notably one of the few sources for roaming (non-zerg) WvW builds.

Specialized Sites
SnowCrows
Builds for raids (and newly, open world). Snowcrows has a history of high-performer optimization, though they do have some beginner builds.
Their profession sections give a great overview for each profession that is worth reading.
They also includes good resources for how to get started in raids
Discretize
Discretize hosts builds for 5-person fractals. Note that discretize builds typically assume use of Fractal-specific potions for extra stats.

Channels
The Downstate Ele
Video guides for easier builds. Some of these builds are also featured on Accessibility Wars, but additional options are in the channel.
Masel (YouTube)
Video guides for Instanced PvE, Open World and help with rotations
MrMystic (YouTube)
Video guides, open world and PvE builds. Some solo stuff too.
Lord Hizen (YouTube)
Not specifically Accessible, but posts a lot of builds that are designed to be very survivable and solo-capable.

https://aw2.help/builds/alac-condi-mecha.body:
Simple but effective Condition Alacrity build
Gearing

Armor: Viper's + Ritualist mix[1] with Runes of the Trapper
Trinkets: Viper's
Weapons: Viper's Pistol/Pistol with Sigils of Bursting/Earth
Relic of the Fractal
Food & Utility: Cilantro Flatbread & Toxic Tuning Crystal

Build



Notes
You give Alacrity with:

 Barrier Signet
 Crisis Zone
 Barrier Burst

And you should prioritise these 3 skills above all else.  Crisis Zone and  Barrier Burst are Mech skills, and can be autocasted. However, due to Mech positioning, you may find yourself dropping Alacrity near the starts of fights, for the 1st and 2nd round of rotations. You should manually cast  Crisis Zone and  Barrier Burst during your first 2 loops to ensure Alacrity doesn't drop.
Use all skills off cooldown in the following priority order:

 Blowtorch (Pistol 4)
 Static Shot (Pistol 3)
 Poison Dart Volley (Pistol 2)
 Overclock Signet

Your CC skills are, in order of priority:

 Glue Shot
 Crash Down (by unsummoning and summoning Mech)
 Static Shot (which makes your Mech do Rocket Punch, but since the cooldown for Rocket Punch is longer that the skill, it might not have CC)

Video

    



Start by adding Ritualist pieces until you are above 20% boon duration, then fill the remaining slots with Viper's. You can replace Viper's gear with more Ritualist if you find yourself dropping Alacrity. ↩

https://aw2.help/builds/alac-condi-mirag.body:
Notes

The concept behind Alacrity Condition Mirage is that you want to use an Ambush attack, specifically  Chaos Vortex, as much as possible, and how you get an Ambush attack is by dodging, or picking up Mirrors. Your next auto attack will be an Ambush after dodging or picking up a Mirror. This is especially important as it's designed to be a support build, and you will give Alacrity through your ambush attacks.
In this build Mirrors will be generated by  False Oasis and  Crystal Sands.  False Oasis drops the Mirror where you're standing, but  Crystal Sands drops the Mirror where you're aiming, and you want to always aim  Crystal Sands inside the hitbox of the boss to ensure all of its hits land. This means you'll have to do the little wiggle I do to pick it up, or you can use  Jaunt, which is a shadowstep, to pick it up.
Ambush attacks also provide high uptime of both Might and Fury for your subgroup.
This build has approximately 23 APM for just the weapon and utility skills, together with dodging. However, due to the high movement required, it is approximated at 40 APM instead, although it could be much lower and closer to 30 APM with better management of skills and mirrors.

If you are having difficulty maintaining Alacrity uptime, you can add Ritualist pieces as required for a small DPS loss


Food (Expertise/Condition Damage):

 Koi Cake (Budget Alternative)


Consumable (Condition Damage):

Build



Rotation

Always start with:
Opener:


 Phantasmal Warlock (Staff 3)
 Phase Retreat (Staff 2)
 Jaunt back into melee range


To generate all 3 clones quickly.
You should use your skills off cooldown with the following priority:
Skill Priority:


 Chaos Armor (Staff 4)
 Crystal Sands, pick up the Mirror and Ambush. You can use Jaunt to pick it up for additional efficiency
Dodge and use  Chaos Vortex without letting your energy fill up completely
 Chaos Storm (Staff 5)
 False Oasis every 28s for the Mirror as well as Lesser Chaos Storm (traited, Chaos 1XX), you can use this off cooldown for a very minor DPS loss if it's too hard to track the cooldown
 Jaunt without letting all 3 charges fill up


Crowd Control

Your CC skills are, in order of priority:
CC Skills:


 Chaos Storm (Staff 5) (Delay this skill in your rotation if you know a CC bar is coming up)
 Diversion (more clones more CC)
 Signet of Midnight (Small CC, moderate DPS loss)
 Signet of Domination (Big CC, big DPS loss)


Advanced Tips

 Distortion is also a very long immune skill, scaling up to a maximum of 3 seconds with the number of clones you currently have, and should be your panic button. It can also be used to dodge mechanics on various raids to increase your damage uptime.
 
You will cast a  Lesser Chaos Storm when you use  False Oasis. However,  False Oasis has a 19s cooldown while  Lesser Chaos Storm has an internal cooldown (unseen) of 27s. You can delay casting  False Oasis to once every 27s instead of casting it off cooldown for a minor DPS increase.

https://aw2.help/builds/alac-condi-spect.body:
The purpose of writing this guide is to provide a competent DPS options with good alacrity uptime and decent DPS output in group PVE content. While weapon swaps are not included in the rotation, swapping to another dagger or a ranged option remains viable choices. This build is functional in both open world and instanced content. While this build has a a moderate skill floor, it has a higher achievable damage ceiling once the basics are secured. Because of the differences in condition types and trait interactions, this build is not efficient with torment unless special arrangements are made, thus three loadouts are explored here but this guide assumes you are following the optimised loadout.
This build requires daggers and unfortunately has a small amount of forced movement. The issues and workarounds with the rotation will be discussed in the guide with a primary focus on accessibility and choosing fights. The featured build is selective for utilities that do not hinder the rotation and has preference for utilities that are multifunctional and smoothens the gameplay experience. Time sensitive skills that disrupt the rotation or involve more button presses may be played situationally and adopted as deemed necessary. This build has intermediate difficulty and although the APM is relatively low, high ping, slow execution and fumbling with your skills can lead to a massive drop in DPS.
Gearing and Consumables
GW2Skills Links

Optimised Loadout
Ranged/Mobile Loadout
Support Loadout



For the purpose of writing a concise guide, I will be focusing on the optimised dual/triple dagger loadout.
The ranged loadout increases torment and scepter use and is aimed at fights where the use of close range dagger attacks become nullified due to boss positioning or mobility. This also assumes that weapon swaps may not be possible.
 The support loadout takes on barrier via consume shadows and also provides boons such as fury if supply from the healer is lacking.

BuildAlac DPS (Optimised)Trait Alternatives
 Consume Shadows is able to provide group barrier if that is missing from your group.[1]
 Traversing Dusk can refill your shroud meter if you bring wells.[2]
Rotation and UtilitiesEnsure skill 1 on both shroud and daggers are set to autocast. You don't have to complete your auto-attack chain, the damage is negligible and prioritising the chain on top of other skills will lead to a DPS drop.RotationPrecasts -  Thieves Guild (Elite) and Utilities (use these on cooldown)
Opener -  Siphon (F1) and  Enter Shadow Shroud (F2)
Alacrity Rotation - Perform autos +  Grasping Shadows (Sh2) +  Eternal Night (Sh4) on cooldown.[3]
DPS rotation - Spam  Death Blossom (D3)[4]
Cast utilities and  Siphon (F1) during/after step 2.[5]
Reset the rotation using  Enter Shadow Shroud (F2).[6]
Utilties
Utilities to cast on cooldown

 Spider Venom
 Devourer Venom
 Caltrops
 Thousand Needles
 Skale Venom (if taking Scepter)


Optional Situational Utilities

 Basilisk Venom
 Well of Bounty
 Well of Gloom
 Well of Sorrow (if taking Scepter/ Traversing Dusk)


Other Strategic Options

 Shadowstep
 Prepare Shadow Portal



Note: All the utilites are optional as your rotation is predetermined by your weapon and shroud skills.
CC options Basilisk Venom is your best CC skill.
In shroud, you can use  Dawn's Repose(Sh3)/ Mind Shock(Sh5) to CCSustainability
 Death Blossom (D3) is an evade. You spend almost half the time in evade frames.
 Enter Shadow Shroud is your second health bar. You spend almost half the time on your second health bar.

Taking  Consume Shadows will obliterate your second health bar but can assist your healers with certain fights if timed well. Use it for group survivabiity.
OptimisationRaid Ready
W1 Vale Guardian -  Consume Shadows before greens gives your healers a super easy time.  Dawn's Repose also adds barrier that fears red orbs away. You can take on guardians of any colour and you have a boon strip through  Bountiful Theft.
W1 Gorseval -  Thousand Needles is a prolonged immobilise that can stop spirits in their tracks. It is also a great damage skills which you can precast  before each main boss phase.
W1 Sabetha - Be careful with  Death Blossom during the flamethrower phase. Bring  Basilisk Venom for Knuckles.
W2 Bandit Trio - Place thousand needles along saboteur routes.
W2 Matthias - Bring  Basilisk Venom to break allies free. Use your shroud CCs if it is not available.
W3 Escort - The large amounts of HP, cleaves and evades make this a good build to fight on towers solo. You also have plenty of immobilise options for backwarg.
W4 Cairn - This build is effective on this fight. Stay in shroud and stack alacrity when he is bouncing around/out of reach.
W4 Mursaat Overseer - Its probably good to bring a thief so you can open the door to the next fight.
W4 Samarog - Bring  Basilisk Venom to break allies free but this is only available on alternate break bars. Use  Thousand Needles or your shroud CCs if it is not available.
W4 Deimos -  Thousand Needles can be used when prides are nearby.  Death Blossom can drop you in the oil so have bit of clearance.
W5 Soulless Horror - You may use your wells/shadowsteps to get through walls. Bring  Basilisk Venom as failing the breakbar is of dire consequence.
W5 Dhuum - Shadowstep is good for this fight, especially CM! Using  Enter Shadow Shroud at 10% skips the ball collection phase.
W6 Twin Largos - Right lane (Kenut) is favourable for condition damage. If timed well, you can use  Death Blossom (🗡️3) to dodge the wave. If you need a wider window, evading drops  Lesser Caltrops too, which is still pretty nifty.
W6 Qadim - You will probably be joining the main squad.  Death Blossom (🗡️3) can be used to dodge the main boss's wave. You may also precast CCs during sub-boss phases.
W7 Adina - Shadowstep options help you move around the arena quickly and can be used in advanced tactics in statics, use your imagination.
W7 Sabir - Try not to blindly  Death Blossom into the red tornado.
Consider an alternative build for
W2 Slothasor - This build does not perform well on Slothasor as conditions reset when he sleeps. Bringing a power option is recommended but this is not a strict contraindication.
W3 Keep Construct - Bringing a power option is recommended but this is not a strict contraindication.
W3 Xera - Bringing a power option is recommended but this is not a strict contraindication.
W6 Conjured Amalgamate - Bringing a power option is recommended.
W7 Qadim the Peerless - If you need to pylon kite, just play a deadeye.


Barriers scale according to your vitality so investment into healing power is not necessary. ↩


This scales to more than 5 players, and is very useful in open world nd Raids/Strikes, less so in fractals. ↩


You may need to stay in shroud for a longer period of time (due to range or to extend alacrity) ↩


Note: Your shroud skill may be non-responsive and doesn't queue well after  Death Blossom (D3)'s aftercast. Using a utility when you are out of initiative to smoothen that. ↩


Some of these have no cast time and can be done mid animation. ↩


This rotation is surprisingly short, you need to enter shroud as soon as you can and not muck about ↩

https://aw2.help/builds/alac-hybrid-scou.body:
This guide explains how hybrid scourge works and how it assists with training runs, low experience practice runs and in statics. This build does rely on a relatively high APM but the order of presses is irrelevant to performance so long as you don't greed DPS and remember to prioritise group alacrity. The forgiving nature of the build allows you to vent your frustrations on the keyboard after a stressful day. Scourge also allows barrier to be pulsed even when disabled.
This build is functional in both open world and instanced content. There is an optional amount of gear swaps that can be done to slide it towards being a stronger healer. While this build has a low skill floor, it does have a high toughness and users should be expected to tank. Tanking isn't terribly difficult on this build however.
For older raids, the build is less optimal than other celestial variants after the recent change to transfusion. The lack of responsive burst heals is the greatest weakness of the class. However this class is still favored in end game content for its two-way teleport ability via  Sand Swell.
Gearing and Consumables
Equipment
Optimised loadout with infusions

Armor/Trinkets: Seraph Set but fill other pieces with other stats up to condi duration cap and the desired amount of healing/toughness.
Alt Stats: Celestial's (recommended)/Ritualist's/Viper's/Plaguedoctor's/Minstrels (For tanking)[1]
Weapons (set 1): Pistol/Torch (Offensive)
Weapons (alt): Sceptre/Warhorn (Defensive)[2]

Weapon Alternatives

Weapons (alt): Dagger/Torch (Healing/Boonstrip)[3]

Runes
 Superior Rune of the Tempest
Sigils
 Superior Sigil of Torment
 Superior Sigil of Demons
 Superior Sigil of Smoldering (Torch)
Relic
 Relic of the Fractal
Food
 Spherified Oyster Soup with Mint Garnish OR
 Feast of Delectable Birthday Cake (Budget/Free)
Utility
 Krait Tuning Crystal
Build
Hybrid DPS Alac



Alternatives
You have many options to play around with other traits and utilities. Necromancer just has so many useful skills that you may not seem obvious at first glance.
Traits

Take  Abrasive Grit where condi cleanses and extra might are needed.
 Life from Death and  Vampiric Presence are competing traits.  Vampiric Presence provides more DPS, weaker heals but has less active interaction required.

Utilities
 Summon Shadow Fiend may not be suitable on certain bosses that remove minions.
 Serpent Siphon is a good group Aegis and Barrier skill.
Swap for  Signet of Undeath and  Summon Shadow Fiend if the APM is too high.
General House Rules:

Swapping traits and skills is a science and you must be knowledgeable on what you can afford to remove.
Might and Alacrity are your primary responsiblities, so use your might generation and barrier skills first.
Be prepared to tank as you have a relatively high toughness.
Both your offensive and defensive sets offer CC, but you can bring more skills for CC.
Hybrid builds have a lot of give and take and toe the line to bring 'just enough', so you need to adjust the build to the strengths of your team composition.

Rotation and Utilities
Rotation

Cast  Manifest Sand Shade and pulse barrier through  Sand Cascade and  Desert Shroud.
Use all your skills on cooldown except  Garish Pillar (F3) and  Signet of Undeath
Use  Garish Pillar with a dodge roll to trigger  Transfusion


Always be on top of a sand shade. Your skills hit like wet noodles without it. Being on shroud keeps your condition duration at 100%.

Crowd Control rotation

Both sets of weapons have CC via  Oppressive Collapse(Torch 5) and  Wail of Doom(Warhorn 4)
 Garish Pillar (F3) can be also used for CC but you may need to reserve this for revive for certain fights.
You may bring  Summon Flesh Golem if you need more CC.
You may bring  Spectral Grasp if you need to pull adds and have extra CC.

Optimisation
Check with your team regarding the boons that you need to cover. If there is already might overcap, you may drop certain skills for more utilities. You can also make an educated guess by looking at the classes the other players are playing, the weapons equipped etc. By default, your build provides Might, Fury, Alacrity, Protection, Regeneration and Aegis but some may not hit 100% uptime. Although Scourge can provide 10-man stability, this area of effect is really small and groups must be really organised to make full use of it. You may also opt to rearrange the subgroup to put tankier classes with the hybrid healer.
Strike Ready

Boneskinner - While it sounds like it is a huge responsibility to play as a carry scourge, you don't die as easily because you have more vitality and higher toughness. Take  Ritual of Life and use  Garish Pillar sparingly.
Whisper of Jormag - Use  Summon Flesh Wurm in the middle during the ball phase.
Harvest Temple -  Sand Swell is really useful to reposition players behind the ball. Swapping to pistol grants more hits against the ball.

Raid Ready

W1 Vale Guardian - Be prepared to tank the fight. If you are not the tank, you may opt to go to the red guardian during splits, which gives the condi team added survivability. Barrier trivialises the green mechanic.  Devouring Darkness removes boons from the blue guardian.
W1 Gorseval -  Grasping Dead is a long reliable cripple during the split phase.
W1 Sabetha - If you bring  Sand Swell, you may be able to serve as a cannon backup. You can  Sand Swell through the flame wall.
W2 Slothasor - This build excels on this fight. Bring  Abrasive Grit for a very strong condi cleanse. Projectile blocks from  Corrosive Poison Cloud are sometimes useful.  Spectral Grasp is useful against slublings.
W2 Matthias - Do not use any projectile blocks unless you know when to use them.
W3 Stronghold of the Faithful - This build can solo towers but it is a little slow, remember to bring  Trail of Anguish for stability/break stun.
W3 Keep Construct - Be prepared to tank this fight. This build doesn't excel in this fight, relying mostly on condis. However, you will still outdps other healers due to the power coefficients on some weapons that feed off your celestial gear.
W4 Cairn - This build excels on this fight in every way.
W4 Samarog - Bring  Summon Flesh Golem for added CC. You can also use  Charge to push Rigom towards the boss. Use  Grasping Dead for a prolonged cripple and fear from  Garish Pillar and  Wail of Doom to steer him back towards the boss if he gets too close.
W4 Deimos CM -  Serpent Siphon is a good aoe Aegis.
W5 Soulless Horror - Your team can  Sand Swell through walls.
W5 Dhuum - This build functions as a decent Tank/G3 in an experienced group but you can't carry too many mistakes as your healing output is lower.
W6 Conjured Amalgamate - This build is not very good for damage on this fight. However, it is not an absolute contraindication to bring this build. If your team only has 1 rebound elementalist/nature's renewal druid, be sure to be on the same group as them so your revive can save the other subgroup after the clap mechanic.
W6 Twin Largos - This build excels on this fight. The right lane (Kenut) favors condition builds. Bring  Summon Flesh Golem for added CC.
W6 Qadim - This build can Kite Qadim, Tank Wyverns or even solo Lamp.
W7 Sabir - Projectile blocks from  Corrosive Poison Cloud is useful.  Garish Pillar is very helpful for players who can't do tornado jumps.
W7 Adina - Projectile blocks from  Corrosive Poison Cloud is useful although not as good as a Ventari Bubble. You can no longer pull allies who identify themselves as sandsharks.
W7 Qadim the Peerless - Consider taking North pylon as you be tanky enough to handle misplaced boss attacks.  Sand Swell does not have the teleport range of other kiters so you need to start moving early.

Videos
I have benched the build with  Feast of Delectable Birthday Cake and  Krait Tuning Crystal, with infusions and no weapon swaps.
DPS benchmark (18.8k)

    



Being cost-effective: Celestial stat is a good pick because it is a core stat and can be obtained from the Wizard's Vault. Your armor requirements will vary depending on your infusions and you may need additional expertise to hit 100% condition duration. Adding more Celestial stats is an option ↩


Weapon swap to warhorn for extra heals. Use torch as default for extra DPS. ↩


Dagger allows more heals through the trait  Overflowing Thirst ↩

https://aw2.help/builds/alac-hybrid-temp.body:
This build is an extension of the condition tempest build. With scepter benefiting from power damage increases, this condition build can scale with multiple stats, making it a great performer in doing multiple roles at once. While this build has a low skill floor, it does have a high toughness and players should be expected to tank. Swapping to water and air for CC is not detrimental compared to camping fire and is included as part of the rotation.
The nature of overloads reduce the physical intensity of the build but this is not a low cognition build. Spending more time exploring the class and reading through the tooltips and guides will help improve your play. The rotation is not hard to perform but the options available are not obvious to a new player. This guide will hence be longer and more detailed than others, with the main focus on a general well-rounded build, and options to scale defensively or offensively. The available choices are not limited to the options presented in this guide.
It is now possible to provide alacrity without using Overload via  Elemental Bastion, this provides a more forgiving alternative for gameplay.
This build aims at achieving the following goals (in order of priority):


Provide 100% Alacrity
Provide necessary boons
Provide adequate Heals
Provide DPS that you can afford


Do attempt to provide 10k or more DPS or you might want to consider playing a pure heal setup instead
Gearing and Consumables
Equipment
Optimised loadout with infusions
EquipmentStatRune/Sigil
All ArmorCelestial Superior Rune of Divinity
Scepter (MH)Celestial Superior Sigil of Smoldering
Warhorn (OH)Celestial Superior Sigil of Water
All TrinketsCelestialN/A
Relic	(Heal)N/A Relic of Karakosa
Relic (DPS)N/A Relic of the Fractal


Being cost-effective: Celestial stat is a good pick because it is a core stat and can be obtained from the Wizard's Vault. You may also just use  Level-80 Equipment Package gear. The default runes and sigils are low-cost.
You may switch  Superior Sigil of Smoldering to  Superior Sigil of Transference if you need more heals.
 Relic of the Flock is overrated and its purpose of converting extra heals into effective heals via barrier is negated by the fact  "Wash the Pain Away!" already does so by triggering multiple heals

Food


 Spherified Oyster Soup with Mint Garnish OR
 Feast of Delectable Birthday Cake (Budget/Free)


Utility

 Bountiful Maintenance Oil

Build
Hybrid DPS Alac



General House Rules


Swapping traits and skills is a science and you must be knowledgeable on what you can afford to remove.
Alacrity is your number 1 responsiblity, so use your aura and overload skills first.
Be prepared to tank as you have a relatively high toughness.
Both water and air attunement offer CC, but you can bring more skills for CC.
Hybrid builds have a lot of give and take and toe the line to bring 'just enough', so you need to adjust the build to the strengths of your team composition.


Basics of Healing
Alacrity Tempest
In order to provide alacrity, you will need share auras. The aura-sharing skills are:


 Overload Fire
 Overload Earth
 Overload Water (only as an emergency heal)
 "Feel the Burn!"
 "Flash-Freeze!"
 "Aftershock!"


Overloads reduce the APM of the build greatly.
Healing Over Time
Tempest has reliable heal over time mechanics, primarily due to long lasting regeneration and soothing mist. In order to maintain soothing mist, water attunement must always be included as a bridge to swapping elements. Each time you swap into water, you provide 10s of soothing mist.
Therefore a simplified elemental cycle will be:


 Overload Fire
 Water Attunement
 Earth Attunement


Providing Boons
Healers also need to provide boons but some healers are missing certain key boons eg. Scourge doesn’t have swiftness. There are two ways to provide swiftness,


 Cyclone (not 100% uptime)
 "Eye of the Storm!" (not 100% uptime)


Thus some players will squeeze air into the rotation.
Burst Heals
You have several options for burst heals:


 Relic of Karakosa is the ideal pick that does a solid heal:



Part of your fire rotation as long as  Wildfire (Fire WH5) is not on cooldown.
Use with water fields for a more potent area heal (this can be tricky, see point 2.)
Blasting fields provided by other allies





Blasting Water fields (water 5)



Blasting Water fields gives an extremely strong triple heal effect.  Water Globe is no longer fleeting and you can pair it with Earth or Fire blast skills.
For other options you need to swap elements to access other blast abilities.





 "Wash the Pain Away!"
 Overload Water


Condi Cleanses
You need to bring 'enough' condi cleanses.


 Cleansing Wave (minor DPS loss)
 Cleansing Water (moderate healing loss)
 Smothering Auras (moderate DPS loss)
Combo:  Powerful Aura +  Unstable Conduit +  Smothering Auras


If you need anything more than this, Cele Scourge may be a better option.
Mastering the Elements
Elemental Cycle
Full Elemental rotation: Our rotation is simply just F1 F2 F3 F4, then F4 F3 F2 F1
F1-F4


 Overload Fire
 Water Attunement
 Air Attunement (optional)
 Earth Attunement


F4-F1 (reverse)


 Overload Earth
 Air Attunement (optional)
 Water Attunement
 Fire Attunement


Rotation
DPS Rotation
(Start in Fire) F1-F4


F1  Overload Fire




F2  Water Attunement



use Water 5/4/3 (1 skill if available)





F3  Air Attunement (optional)



use Air 5/4/3 (1 skill if available)





F4  Earth Attunement



use Earth 5 to 1 in descending order



F4-F1 (reverse)


F4  Overload Earth




F3  Air Attunement (optional)



use Air 5/4/3 (1 skill if available)





F2  Water Attunement



use Water 5/4/3 (1 skill if available)





F1  Fire Attunement



use Fire 5 to 1 in descending order



Crowd Control rotation


 Tidal Surge (Wh4 while attuned to water)
 Cyclone (Wh4 while attuned to air)
Other soft CC skills
Additional Adaptions for CC



 Conjure Frost Bow ->  Deep Freeze
 Glyph of Elementals ->  Crashing Waves (Also works as a spike heal)



Optimisation
Omitting Air
 Air Attunement is always optional in the rotation. This can be omitted in order to speed up the elemental cycle for various reasons:


You need to get access to water faster.
You already have sufficient swiftness.
You need to blast your water field.
You need to reapply certain boons.


Check with your team regarding the boons that you need to cover.

Raid Ready

W1 Vale Guardian - You should be able to heal through greens pretty easily. Blast your healing fields before and after greens happen. Reserve  Overload Water for emergencies.
W1 Gorseval - You may want to bring stability and aegis for this fight. Immobilising with  Signet of Earth is also useful during the split phase.
W1 Sabetha - Probably not a good idea to flak kite due to the way alac is distributed, unless you want to stay really close to the party. You can however use  Lightning Flash to navigate past flame wall, which is pretty nifty.
W2 Slothasor - You will need to bring more condition cleanses for this fight and in doing so, will sacrifice damage
W3 Tower - This build can solo towers due to its moderate damage, high defenses, empowered protection and passive healing (even when you get knocked down). Bring  Relic of Vampirism if you need survivability and  Harmonious Conduit for stability. You can use  Tidal Surge as a push.
W3 Xera - This build can tank xera and clear crystals at the same time.
W4 Cairn - This build is excellent on this fight. Be careful of  Magnetic Aura as it can kill your allies.
W4 Mursaat Overseer - Healing is not a priority and you can opt for more damage choices. You should however retain survival options for jade armors and the resultant death nova.
W4 Samarog - Healing through this fight is extremely easy. CC however is quite a pain and you may consider bringing  Conjure Frost Bow for CC. Otherwise try to bait as the tank if you can.
W4 Deimos - Due to your high toughness, you are likely to tank and will function as a great tank. Group aegis through  "Aftershock!" is extremely effective in CM! Bring  Arcane Shield as a non-interruptible backup.
W5 Soulless Horror - You have enough toughness to tank this fight, enough damage to contribute. CC is going to be your biggest weakness.  Lightning Flash can navigate through walls.
W5 Dhuum - With your toughness, you will probably tank on this fight. You may opt to bring movement skills if you are doing the green mechanic (G3) as the tank.
W6 Conjured Amalgamate -  "Rebound!" is often used to bypass the clap mechanic on your subgroup.
W6 Twin Largos - This build does well tanking on either lanes for this fight.
W6 Qadim - Your CCs are not particularly super responsive so you need to know the fight well.
W7 Adina -  Magnetic Aura is pretty cool on this fight.
W7 QTP - You are probably not the best tank on the list, but not the worst either. Unlike other tanks you can't exactly sit comfortably on the roads mechanic with damage mitigation strategies and you probably will accidentally point your cones in the wrong direction if you aren't careful enough.

Pitfalls and Special Roles


Just in case the other healer has 2k toughness and you are considering, Tempest in general does not perform as a better hand kite than other alternatives. You have to change a lot of things in the build which is outside the scope of this guide.
You need to sacrifice a lot to be able do significant condi cleanses. It is viable but isn't a great performer on slothasor.
The reflects on elementalist can be a little janky on Matthias. I recommend sticking to the tradition of using mesmers and guardians.

In our testing, the  Elemental Bastion does equal amounts of damage and maintains alacrity equally well. In low pressure fights, you may use  Relic of the Fractal, utilities and infusions to easily punch above 20k DPS.

Notes
You give Alacrity with:

 Barrier Signet
 Crisis Zone
 Barrier Burst

And you should prioritise these 3 skills above all else.  Crisis Zone and  Barrier Burst are Mech skills, and can be autocasted. However, due to Mech positioning, you may find yourself dropping Alacrity near the starts of fights, for the 1st and 2nd round of rotations. You should manually cast  Crisis Zone and  Barrier Burst during your first 2 loops to ensure Alacrity doesn't drop.
Press

 Refraction Cutter (Sword 2)
 Radiant Arc (Sword 3)
 Overclock Signet

off cooldown, and that is basically your rotation.
Your auto attack chain reduces the cooldown of  Refraction Cutter (Sword 2) and  Radiant Arc (Sword 3), allowing you to cast them more often. This lines up pretty well and results in you being able to use  Radiant Arc (Sword 3) every other time you use  Refraction Cutter (Sword 2).
You have very nice utilities with the Shield. You can bring a Pistol instead for about ~800 more DPS, but I will always recommend the Shield over Pistol.
 Magnetic Shield (Shield 4) is a 3s long projectile reflect, and can be pressed twice in quick succession for CC.
 Static Shield (Shield 5) is a 2.5s long block, and is basically your panic button. It can also be pressed twice in quick succession for CC.
On top of that, you have  Overclock Signet, which is a CC skill even though it is used primarily for damage. Finally, you have  Force Signet, which is another CC skill, but you should only use it in the most dire of situations, as using it is a DPS loss.

Build



Rotation

You always want to precast  Glyph of Elementals, as well as  Overload Air, before the fight starts. As much as possible you want to hit your precast  Overload Air, but that is not always possible on all bosses.
Start in:


 Fire Attunement


Precast:


 Glyph of Elementals
 Air Attunement
 Overload Air


And immediately enter
Main Loop:


 Fire Attunement
 Dragon's Tooth (Scepter Fire 2)
 Phoenix (Scepter Fire 3)
 Wildfire (Warhorn Fire 5)
 Air Attunement
 Lightning Orb (Warhorn Air 5)
 Lightning Storm ( Glyph of Storms in  Air Attunement)
 Overload Air


Repeat from step 1 as soon as  Fire Attunement is off cooldown.
Skip:


 Wildfire (Warhorn Fire 5)
 Lightning Orb (Warhorn Air 5)
 Lightning Storm


if they are on cooldown.
Do note that  Overload Air has a ~3.5s cast time, and dodging or swapping attunements during it's cast will interrupt it and result in a large DPS loss. You can still move and use skills with no cast time, as well as queue a skill to cast after. This is exceptionally important as you will be trying to swap to  Fire Attunement as quickly as possible after completing  Overload Air.
Cast Off Cooldown:


 Lightning Strike (Scepter Air 2)
 "Feel the Burn!"
 Flame Barrage


All of these skills have no cast time and can be cast anytime, even during  Overload Air.
In summary, the rotation can be simplified as
Simplified Rotation:


 Fire Attunement 2 3 5
 Air Attunement 2 5
 Overload Air
Repeat


 Overload Air takes ~4s to cast, and you can use the downtime to cast your 'off cooldown' skills.
Crowd Control

Your CC skills are:


 Blinding Flash (Scepter Air 3)
 Cyclone (Warhorn Air 4)
 Tidal Surge (Warhorn Water 4)
 Dust Devil (Scepter Earth 3)
 Dust Storm (Warhorn Earth 5)


 Blinding Flash (Scepter Air 3) and  Cyclone (Warhorn Air 4) should be on your skill bar most of the time, and if you require more CC, you can replace the step of  Fire Attunement 2 3 5 with either:


 Water Attunement 2 3 4
 Earth Attunement 3 5


with a preference of  Water Attunement 2 3 4, before continuing your rotation back in  Air Attunement.
Advanced Tips

You will notice that the Alacrity timing is a little tight for the first loop, and you might find yourself slightly dropping Alacrity at some moments, especially if you do not have quickness at the start of the fight.
To counteract this, use  Earth Attunement 3 4 5 for your first loop instead of  Fire Attunement 2 3 5, and you can continue to slot in  Earth Attunement 3 4 5 instead of  Fire Attunement 2 3 5 anytime you feel your Alacrity is running low (can look at boon bar for confirmation).
 
You can replace  Glyph of Elementals with  "Rebound!" for a minor DPS loss as a subgroup wide panic button, or to skip certain mechanics to improve group DPS. Such mechanics include, but are not limited to, Deimos' Mind Crush, Dhuum's bomb mechanic, and Sabir's shockwave (Unbridled Tempest).

Condition Chronomancer is a simple build with solid damage potential. Due to the high amounts of Confusion it applies, it excels at fights with fast-attacking bosses.
It has very high range and is able to provide all important Boons to itself in open world gameplay: (Might, Stability, Aegis, Regeneration, Quickness, Alacrity, Fury and Protection).
It can also be turned into a simple Alacrity or Quickness provider with just one trait change.

Build



Rotation

In the opener, we're making use of  Continuum Split in a simple way to reset phantasms and creating a nice amount of burst damage.
Opener:


 Mirror Images ->  Continuum Split
 Phantasmal Warlock (Staff 3) ->  Signet of the Ether ->  Phantasmal Warlock (Staff 3)
Fit any other skill you are able to before  Continuum Split ends
 Phantasmal Warlock (Staff 3) ->  Signet of the Ether ->  Phantasmal Warlock (Staff 3)


You can use this opener whenever there is a phase change and  Continuum Split is off cooldown.
The rest of the rotation is priority based and should be performed after your opener.
Priority:


 Phantasmal Warlock (Staff 3)
 Signet of the Ether ->  Phantasmal Warlock (Staff 3)
 Rewinder ->  Split Second ->  Mirror Images
 Chaos Armor (Staff 4)
 Chaos Storm (Staff 5)
 Phase Retreat (Staff 2)


Take note that  Phase Retreat (Staff 2) teleports you away from your target by 360 distance, and you'll have to move back towards the target after every time you cast it.
 Mirror Images has a longer cooldown than  Rewinder and will not always be available. Skip  Mirror Images if it is on cooldown.
Crowd Control

Your CC skills are, in order of priority:
CC Skills:


 Signet of Humility
 Chaos Storm (Staff 5)
 Time Sink (Small DPS Loss)
 Signet of Domination (Big DPS Loss)


 Signet of Humility does 600 breakbar damage, and will almost always be enough CC as long as everyone in your group is doing some CC. You should wait a bit before using your other CC skills once you have cast  Signet of Humility.
 Chaos Storm (Staff 5) is used in your damage rotation and might not always be available.
Build Concepts

Like core mesmer, the gameplay on chrono evolves around creating clones of yourself and then shattering them.
Creating clones can be done in two ways:


Directly by skills or traits that create clones on certain actions, like  Phase Retreat (Staff 2)
Indirectly by using phantasm skills, like  Phantasmal Warlock (Staff 3), which perform an attack and then turn into clones afterwards


 Illusionary Membrane increases your condition damage by 7% for 5 seconds when you apply Chaos Aura to yourself and stacks in duration.
 Sharper Images makes your illusions apply bleeding on critical hits, making it very important to have three clones up at all times. This build generates a lot of clones and rarely shatters them, making it relatively easy to execute.
 Improved Alacrity makes Alacrity stronger but harder to keep up. With this trait, your skills recharge in ~67% (two thirds) of their original cooldown time. This increases the APM of the build, but is also a very strong boost to everything you do.
 Chronophantasma makes your Phantasms exceptionally strong, since they do their damage twice in a row. That's why using  Phantasmal Warlock (Staff 3) and resetting it with  Signet of the Ether are your main priorities.
 Continuum Split
 Continuum Split deserves its own section, as it is one of the unique aspects of  Chronomancer.
It reverts time, in that it will save the skill cooldowns, health and position when you activate it.
Then, for each Clone you shattered with it, it gives you more time to use skills and have them reverted.

Spawn all minions to distract enemies
Go into  Reaper's Shroud, drop an ice field with  Executioner's Scythe
Use  Soul Spiral in the ice field
When out of shroud, use  "Rise!" when you can hit at least 3 enemies, and then build life force
When your minions die, they will spawn poison fields due to  Death Nova. Poison application also grants Carapace as well as causing some damage and inhibiting enemy healing.
Try to combo  Soul Spiral in the poison fields to create additional poison bolts
Use the Bone Minion's flipover skill,  Putrid Explosion, to quickly generate fields. This is also a blast finisher.

Open World Tagging

If you're in a large group PvE environment, swap to staff to tag lots of targets

Staff also brings more opportunites to inflict bleeding to proc  Blood Bond, essentially giving life steal to allies

and transfer them to enemies. This is incredibly good in high condi fights like Slothasar. Note that each minion has an independent 10
second cooldown. Mass minion summons like  "Rise!" will stack those cooldowns, so it can be advantageous to spread
other summons out if possible.

https://aw2.help/builds/condi-soulbeast/.body:
The purpose of writing this guide is to provide a no-weapon swap method to play a ranged PVE soulbeast while easily hitting the 70% benchmark with minimal effort. This build is low cognition, has few repetitions but has a relatively high APM. The skills do not require specific timing and having extra hard CC (total of 4) in the build allows flexible upkeep of  Twice as Vicious, which has a rather tight timing on other builds. The auto-attack of the build provides sufficient hits to proc bleeding and the skills that empower the shortbow hits do not interrupt the attack rotation. The way the bows are empowered with bleeding stacks is inspired by the Guild Wars 1 skill Barbed Arrows.
As of 2025, the build has been updated to use the juvenile bee and shifts its damage focus more towards poison with a very decent extra 300 points of CC. Stat adjustments have been made to accomodate standard condition DPS food.

Optimised Viper's Loadout
GW2Skills Link
Relic

 Relic of Thorns (default)
 Relic of the Fractal (test)


It is not possible to bench  Relic of Thorns due to the conditions required to trigger it at the golem.
 Relic of the Blightbringer has been considered but remains a much weaker version as there is a hidden ICD, preventing
Poison Volley from proccing multiple times.

Food

 Cilantro and Cured Meat Flatbread
 Koi Cake(budget alternative)

Utility

 Toxic Tuning Crystal

Pets


The Janthiri Bee is competitive in damage and provides ready access CC, making it the default best option for raiding.
The Wallow provides a poison field, decent healing and condition cleanses which is good in open world.
Other options include the Bristleback, Jungle Spider, Jaguar, Warthog and Black Widow.


Build
Condi DPS\


Juvenile WallowJuvenile Janthiri Bee
Trait Alternatives
The equipment stats are fairly similar to the that of SnowCrows with selection of different traits.
Rotation and Utilities
DPS Rotation
Stay merged at all times.


Early Precast -  Spike Trap
Pre-battle -  One Wolf Pack +  Sharpening Stone +  Vulture Stance +  Sharpen Spines (if using Bristleback)
General Rotation - Use all non-healing skills on cooldown except F1


Crowd Control


You have decent CC by just using  Concussion Shot (Shortbow 4)
You have many other CC skills littered in your weapon/pet/utility kit including the ones used to upkeep  Twice as Vicious (see below).
You can precast  Sharpening Stone for additional CC just before the CC phase of an encounter.
Your Pet F3 skill does a taunt. This is counted as decent CC.


Sustainability


You may opt to take  Healing Spring for better condi cleanse
 Quick Shot (Shortbow 3) is an evade that does a step back. This is useful for bosses with pull mechanics.
If you need an extra heal, you may swap your pet to the Wallow for  Spiritual Reprieve


Optimisation
Twice as Vicious


Spread out  Sharpening Stone,  Primal Cry and  Concussion Shot to maximise  Twice as Vicious uptime.
Use your other pet CC skills if your coverage is falling such as  Bumble.
You may wish to delay using  Concussion Shot as it is a potent CC skill.


Dodging


Where dodging is necessary, you may delay  Quick Shot by 4s after the dodge to have better uptime of  Light on your Feet.
It is better to use  Quick Shot to dodge once if you don't need to dodge twice for better DPS uptime.


Raid Ready

W1 Gorseval - Immobilise with  Entangle during the split phase.
W2 Slothasor - Jaguar is useful for  Prelude Lash to pull slublings. Make sure to point your bow away from ally slubs!
W2 Bandit Trio - The range, self sustainability and high amounts of CC allows this build to do mortars.
W3 Escort - For backwarg, bring  Entangle and use  Crippling Shot to immobilise. For frontwarg, black widow/jungle spider is useful for  Prelude Lash to pull white mantle and  Entangling Web provides meaningul immobilise uptime on the frontwarg.
W4 Cairn - This build does superb on Cairn, no adjustment is necessary, though you may wish to use  "We Heal As One!" if you are baiting red circles for the group. Also see dodge section above as you will very often be dodging to move if celestial dash is unavailable.
W4 Samarog -  Spike Trap can be used to launch Rigom, although the pushback from longbow and using a power build is preferred.
W5 Dhuum - Use  Quick Shot during the suck phase.
W6 This build is excellent on Twin Largos as it is.
This build can be used to pylon kite. Camp shortbow with Juvenile Hawk. Switch to sword. You movement skills are  Swoop (catch) and  Swoop(return). Take note that unlike other kiting classes, your return skill cannot survive dashing through fires.

Videos
I have benched the build with no infusions. Budget food and budget utilities were used.
DPS benchmark (27.7k solo, 30k with allies)

This build does heavy burning damage, relying on Sigil of the Earth to inflict bleeding upon critting to activate Relic of the Fractal. The gear and food for this build maxmises burning duration to 100%, then concentrating the rest of the stats into Condition Damage, Power, and Precision.

Build



Rotation

You start in  Fire Attunement and will stay in  Fire Attunement for the entirety of the rotation, swapping to other elements only for CC.
Always precast:


 Glyph of Lesser Elementals
 Glyph of Elementals


Beforet the fight begins. Ideally you want to have 3  Glyph of Lesser Elementals precasted, but just having 1 is fine.
Cast off cooldown:


 Overload Fire
 Dragon's Tooth (Scepter 2)
 Phoenix (Scepter 3)
 Flamewall (Warhorn 4)
 Fire Shield (Warhorn 5)
 Transmute Fire (Warhorn 5 Flip)
 Firestorm
 Glyph of Lesser Elementals
 Signet of Fire
 Flame Barrage


Prioritizing  Overload Fire above all else. You will not be able to cancel  Overload Fire with any other skill listed above, so spam away.
You can cast the rest of your skills in any particular order, minimising the amount of time each skill is spent off cooldown whenever possible.
 Overload Fire will also cause  Fire Shield to flip to  Transmute Fire by generating a Fire Aura, and since  Transmute Fire has a shorter cooldown than  Fire Shield, cast  Transmute Fire whenever it is available and not just after  Fire Shield.
Recast  Glyph of Elementals whenever it is available, as  Glyph of Elementals will not last the entire fight duration for most fights.
 Flame Barrage has no cast time, and can be cast even when in the middle of  Overload Fire or during the cast/aftercast of any other skill.
Crowd Control

Your CC skills are:


 Shatterstone (Scepter Water 2)
 Freezing Gust (Focus Water 4)
 Comet (Focus Water 5)
 Blinding Flash (Scepter Air 3)
 Gale (Focus Air 5)
 Dust Devil (Scepter Earth 3)
 Magnetic Wave (Focus Earth 4)


This may seem overwhelming at first, but you can simply follow the below simplified CC rotation.
Simplified CC Rotation:


 Water Attunement 2 4 5
 Air Attunement 3 5
 Earth Attunement 3 4


Swap back to  Fire Attunement as soon as it is off cooldown, and continue your rotation from there. Do not cast  Glyph of Lesser Elementals,  Firestorm,  Glyph of Lesser Elementals, or  Glyph of Elementals in any other attunement, as doing so will result in a DPS loss.

https://aw2.help/builds/condi-virtuoso/.body:
A primarily bleed based build that applies bleed through critical hits.
Notes

Condition  Virtuoso is a build that is simple to play and provides very consistent damage with high range. That allows you to freely position yourself and maintain your damage output, even when mechanics force you into range.
This build is also capable of doing large amounts of CC, and has multiple skills that can be swapped around for more utility, making it an excellent build for almost all bosses and situations.
It is also relatively sturdy for a DPS build, and has good HP self sustain.
Gearing
 There are multiple gear combinations that will arrive at the same total value of stats.

Sinister Krait

Rampager's Krait

Sinister Krait
Rampager's Krait


WeaponTypeStatUpgrade

	
	Dagger
	Viper's
	 Bursting


	
	Torch
	Viper's
	 Earth



TrinketsTypeStat
Back item Rampager's
Amulet Rampager's
Accessory Rampager's
Accessory Sinister

TrinketsTypeStat
Ring Rampager's
Ring Rampager's
Relic Fractal 


Food:  Cilantro and Cured Meat Flatbread or  Plate of Beef Rendang
Enhancement:  Toxic Tuning Crystal

Build



Rotation

To maximise damage on Condition Virtuoso, you should space out your Bladesong Skills in order to upkeep  Deadly Blades, as this provides you with a +5% all damage buff. However, as you only want to use Bladesong Skills when you have 5 stacks of Blades, this naturally spaces out your Bladesong Skills, allowing you to maintain full uptime of  Deadly Blades.
Opener:


 Bladesong Sorrow
 Phantasmal Mage (Torch 5)
 Bladecall (Dagger 2)
 Unstable Bladestorm (Dagger 3)
Wait for 5 stacks of Blades
 Bladeturn Requiem
 Signet of Illusions


The rest of your rotation follows a priority list of skills you should use off cooldown.
Use Off Cooldown:


 Bladesong Sorrow (only use with 5 blades)
 Bladesong Harmony (only use with 5 blades)
 Bladeturn Requiem  (only use with 5 blades)
 Phantasmal Mage (Torch 5)
 Unstable Bladestorm (Dagger 3)
 Bladecall (Dagger 2)
 The Prestige (Torch 4)


Outside of this priority, you should also cast  Thousand Cuts as soon as it is off cooldown, as it has no cast time and will not interrupt your current action.
After every cast of  Bladeturn Requiem, if  Signet of Illusions is off cooldown, you should use it immediately, as in the opener, pairing these 2 skills together whenever possible.
You should also pair  Mantra of Recovery with  The Prestige (Torch 4), casting it whenever you have used  The Prestige (Torch 4).  Mantra of Recovery places an Ethereal Field every other cast due to  Method of Madness and  The Prestige (Torch 4) is a Blast finisher with a 3 second delay. The two skills share the same cooldown, so you can always pair them.
Crowd Control

Your CC skills are, in order of priority
CC Skills:


 Phantasmal Mage (Torch 5)
 Bladesong Dissonance (use with as many blades as possible)
 Signet of Domination (big DPS loss, not recommended)


As  Phantasmal Mage (Torch 5) is used in your damage rotation, it might not always be off cooldown. You should delay it if you know a CC bar is about to come up.
If more CC is required, replace  Thousand Cuts with  Signet of Humility.  Signet of Humility is one of the largest CC skills in the game, doing 600 breakbar damage, and should be prioritised above all other CC skills if you have brought it. Skip the rest of your CC skills if you have used  Signet of Humility, as using those CC skills is a DPS loss.
Blades and Related Traits


Blade skills deserve their own section, as it is one of the unique aspects of Virtuoso.
They replace Clones and related traits 1-to-1, with the exception that they are not linked to the target they are used against. Every Blade stocked remains above you as a floating dagger, empowering your Shatter skills.
You stock one Blade every 10 seconds when out of combat.
Through  Bloodsong, you will stock a blade on every fifth stack of Bleeding you apply.
Paired with  Jagged Mind (and  Sharper Images on  Dueling), you will stock up Blades very fast. This relies on Critical hits, making Precision and other sources of Critical chance an important stat on Virtuoso.

Advanced Tips

 Bladesong Distortion is also a very long immune skill, up to 3.75 seconds if you use it with maximum stacks of blades, and should be your panic button. It can also be used to dodge mechanics on various raids to increase your damage uptime.
 
If you are fighting a boss that requires Reflect (i.e Matthias, Greer),
Replace:


 Signet of Midnight


With:


 Feedback


And use  Feedback whenever you need to reflect.
Video

Fast paced, high APM, press everything off cooldown build rotating between  Fire Attunement and  Earth Attunement for maximum burning and bleeding damage.
Condition Weaver relies on rotating quickly through two elements in order to have high uptime on both  Weaver's Prowess and  Elements of Rage, increasing damage done and condition duration.
This build is also primarily ranged, accounting for ~93% of it's damage. Small tweaks can be made to bring this number up to ~98%, and will be addressed under advanced tips.

Consumables:

Cilantro and Cured Meat Flatbread (Condi Damage/Expertise Damage)
Toxic Tuning Crystal (Condi Damage)



Build




Rotation

Start in:


 Fire Attunement/ Earth Attunement


Precast:


 Glyph of Lesser Elementals × 3 (if possible)
 Glyph of Elementals


Your main loop consists of swapping between  Fire Attunement and  Earth Attunement, while casting all your damage dealing skills off cooldown.
Main Loop:


 Fire Attunement/ Earth Attunement, press  Fire Attunement
 Fire Attunement/ Fire Attunement, press  Earth Attunement
 Earth Attunement/ Fire Attunement, press  Fire Attunement
Repeat


Cast Off Cooldown:


 Dragon's Tooth ( Fire Attunement Scepter 2)
 Phoenix ( Fire Attunement Scepter 3)
 Flamewall ( Fire Attunement Focus 4)
 Fire Shield ( Fire Attunement Focus 5)
 Transmute Fire ( Fire Attunement Focus 5 Flipped)
 Rock Barrier ( Earth Attunement Scepter 2)
 Hurl ( Earth Attunement Scepter 2 Flipped)
 Magnetic Wave ( Earth Attunement Focus 4)
 Fracturing Strike (Dual Scepter 3)
 Signet of Fire
 Primordial Stance
 Flame Barrage
 Glyph of Lesser Elementals


You can replace off hand Focus with Warhorn, although based on my testing the damage isn't much better, you can choose to go with whichever weapon you prefer.
Crowd Control

You have
CC Skills:


 Shatterstone ( Water Attunement Scepter 2)
 Freezing Gust ( Water Attunement Focus 4)
 Comet ( Water Attunement Focus 5)
 Gale ( Air Attunement Focus 5)
 Glacial Drift (Dual Scepter 3)
 Earthen Synergy (Dual Scepter 3)


However, these skills are locked behind elements that you do not use in your rotation. To fully utilize your CC, you should use the following CC Loop.
CC Loop


 Water Attunement
 Shatterstone ( Water Attunement Scepter 2)
 Air Attunement
 Glacial Drift (Dual Scepter 3)
 Freezing Gust ( Water Attunement Focus 4)
 Comet ( Water Attunement Focus 5)
 Earth Attunement
 Gale ( Air Attunement Focus 5)
 Earthen Synergy (Dual Scepter 3)


And continue your rotation from Step #3 in the Main Loop.
This may seem very intimidating at first, but in simplified form it is just:


 Water Attunement 2
 Air Attunement 3 4 5
 Earth Attunement 3 5


Sometimes, you do not need so much CC, in that case you can use a shortened loop.
Short CC Loop


 Water Attunement
 Shatterstone ( Water Attunement Scepter 2)
 Earth Attunement
 Freezing Gust ( Water Attunement Focus 4)
 Comet ( Water Attunement Focus 5)
 Stone Tide (Dual Septer 3)


And continue your rotation from Step #3 in the Main Loop.
Once again, the simplified form will look like:


 Water Attunement 2
 Earth Attunement 3 4 5


Having to CC will result in a significant DPS loss, and it is recommended to bring this class only if the fight has very low CC pressure, no CC at all, or if your supports are able to carry the CC.
Advanced Tips

To convert this build to do more damage at ranged, replace:


 Primordial Stance


with either:


 Glyph of Elemental Power
 Firestorm


Generally you want to pick  Glyph of Elemental Power over  Firestorm as  Glyph of Elemental Power can be precast, and has no cast time, allowing for minimal impact to your rotation. However,  Firestorm tends to do more damage on fights that the bosses that have lower armour, as well as on bosses that do not move much.
 
Try to use:


 Flamewall ( Fire Attunement Focus 4)


before:


 Dragon's Tooth ( Fire Attunement Scepter 2)
 Phoenix ( Fire Attunement Scepter 3)


whenever possible as that will allow you to blast might for your squad.
Video

This bench is done with  Glyph of Lesser Elementals despite the inherent RNG of the skill. However, it has not been precast, and will therefore always result in a lower number than using  Glyph of Elemental Power. This means that I am able to show off the full rotation and build without inflating the final damage number. I choose to leave it in because I have seen many players who don't read and just use  Glyph of Elemental Power during the actual fights.

Build



Notes
Your main combo is:

 Purging Flames
 Rushing Justice
 Whirling Light

And you should prioritise this combo whenever  Purging Flames is off cooldown.
Using  Rushing Justice activates Willbender Flames, which allows you to apply stacks of burning every hit.  Whirling Light and  Purging Flames both have multiple hits, which synergises well. It also swirls within the fire field created by  Purging Flames, generating burning bolts.
However,  Rushing Justice has a shorter cool down than  Purging Flames, and you should use it a second time off cooldown outside of the main combo.
You might also run into a situation where  Purging Flames and  Rushing Justice are desynced. If that happens, you should continue to use both  Purging Flames and  Rushing Justice off cooldown out of sync, and combo  Rushing Justice with  Whirling Light.
Beyond your main rotation, you should use:

 Zealot's Flame (Torch 4)
 Symbol of Ignition (Pistol 3)
 Peacekeeper (Pistol 2)

Off cooldown and in that order of priority.
Pressing  Zealot's Flame (Torch 4) activates  Zealot's Fire, and you should press it when all other skills are on cooldown.
 Peacekeeper (Pistol 2) has a very long cast time, and you should be wary of using it right before your main combo, as delaying the main combo results in a much larger DPS loss than delaying  Peacekeeper (Pistol 2).
Crowd Control
You only have 1 CC skill,  Heaven's Palm, with a very short cooldown of 20s (15s with Alacrity), but that's enough CC to carry your own weight in every encounter in the game, as it does quite a bit of breakbar damage at 450.

https://aw2.help/builds/heal-alac-chrono.body:
Assuming your party is experienced and only require a tank with multiple reliable blocks to ensure minimal risk of failure, majority of your actions will be based on the scepter auto-attack. The end of the auto-attack chain  Ether Clone procs  Illusionary Inspiration to provide heals and empower your shatter skills. Aegis and Stability are available on demand.
This build is has low physical complexity, has very few repetitions and is functional in instanced content, especially for new players wanting to volunteer for learning tank roles. You may find that the tanking ability is superior to other classes but relying on scepter alone without proper planning may result in mediocre healing. While this guide assumes no weapon swap is needed, to maximise its heal utility, you may consider swapping to rifle.

Consumables

Build
Heal Quickness Build




Swap to stretched time for Alacrity instead of Quickness

Rotation and Utilities
Firstly, do not panic. Chronomancer is an easy but brainy class to play. A lot of mechanics are invisible and running in the backend.
Opener
You may wish to adapt an opener into your rotation for initial quickness. Time warp is also useful for initial quickness.
The methods of executing your opener is non-exhaustive and you will find new ways that will suit your own playstyle. Many opener variations may include utilities but generally fulfil the following purpose

Generate Alacrity/Quickness with minimal downtime.
Stack might right at the start of the fight
Provide essential boons required for the particular encounter.
Provide boons that are missing from the subgroup.

An example opener would be

F5  Tides of Time
F1-F4 All your shatter skills
With clones, you may be able to double cast  Tides of Time (Shield 5) which translates to faster stacking of might stacks.
The above is used due to easy execution, instant alacrity/quickness and early might, fury, protection, resistance, stability, regeneration and vigor.

Principles of generating Alacrity/Quickness

Generate Clones using autos -  Ether Clone.
Use shatter skills when clones are full to heal allies and grant alacrity/quickness.
Using Phantasm skills from your weapon skills and utilties also generate a significant amount of alacrity/quickness.



In an experienced group, assuming you have a herald, players who avoid damage and are expert at mechanics, these two steps are the core foundation of your build.
Your last attack on the auto chain generates clones so you won't have enough quickness if you don't finish the auto chains. Nobody actually watches the chain but you know you need to auto when your clones are not coming.
The rotation for quickness and alacrity is the same.
You need to reserve backup when you can't generate clones or give boons. That's what the utilities are for.
Phantasms generate more alacrity than clones, it will be good to bring at least 1-2.


Maintenance Heals

Clone generation provides a small but steady heal.
Shattering clones provides a more sizeable heal.

Burst Heals

Reserve the use of your wells if you can anticipate a large attack (eg. VG greens)
Use your  Mantra of Recovery as your emergency heal.[1]
Your shatter skills provide significant heals even without clones.[2]
Additional Mantras can be used in place of wells for very mobile fights.

Crowd Control

You have decent CC by just using  Tides of Time (Shield 5).
 Diversion (Shatter F3) provides a small CC.
You can bring  Signet of Humility (Elite) for a mega CC.
You can bring  Gravity Well (Elite) for a sizeable CC with other beneficial effects.

Tanking Rotation

Cycle between your blocks

 Illusionary Counter
 Echo of Memory ->  Deja Vu
 Well of Precognition


Group Aegis can also be used but reserve it when it is absolutely required.

Other utilities and trait combos

Bring  Phantasmal Disenchanter /  Arcane Thievery for boon strips.
You may take  Master of Manipulation for more/backup group aegis.
Advanced strategies can be used with  Mimic to duplicate skills for example:

Multi-feedback
Multi-blink


Advanced strategies can be used with  Continuum Split to duplicate skills for example:

Double  Conjured Slash
Double Moa CC


More advanced strategies can be used by combining  Mimic and  Continuum Split

Optimisation
Raid Ready

W1 Vale Guardian - Use wells just before greens. This allows heals to come in right after green triggers. You can also use  Well of Precognition to shield allies against teleport circles.  Phantasmal Disenchanter and  Arcane Thievery can strip boons off the Blue Guardian.
W1 Gorseval - Start with initial stability which protects against the initial swipe. Subsequently, face the boss away from your group.  Mantra of Concentration is also useful here.
W1 Sabetha - You can teleport through flame wall with  Blink. You have lots of CC options for Knuckles.
W2 Slothasor - You need steady condition cleanses so spread the use of your shatters. Swapping to rifle is useful to heal players dropping poisons who are out of reach, bonus points if you can port them back to the group (coordination is difficult).  Into the Void is often used to deal with slublings.
W2 Matthias - Bring  Feedback for reflects but if you are short of them, you can use  Mimic to reset them. You have lots of CC options, but you may want to preserve  Signet of Humility (Elite) when sacrifice mechanic is about to fail. The focus reflect options are too clunky to be reliable on this fight.
W3 Escort - Most Chrono Tanks can swap to become a Tower Chrono. This is a niche build and not covered in this guide.
W3 Twisted Castle - You may wish to attempt the button with the statues (left split). In this case after the double doors, use  Echo of Memory immediately after entering and face them as they will throw hammers, then  Blink to the next button. More skips can be done with an elementalist pair combo using Fiery Greatsword and clever use of portals and blink.
W3 Xera - You are likely to tank this fight. This fight is mostly based on positioning.  Into the Void (Focus Pull 4) is useful when tanking as it allows your team to cleave them more easily.
W4 Cairn - Stability is required for skipping greens. Bring  Well of Precognition and  Mantra of Concentration.
W4 Mursaat Overseer - Improved alacrity will allow you to claim tiles faster than other class. Using  Continuum Split to duplicate Claim will allow you to claim tiles even faster, especially useful in CM.
W4 Samarog - Try to bait as tank as much as possible. You can pre-cast your CC such as  Tides of Time (Shield 5) before he pins you down (health bar indicator).
W4 Deimos - Group Aegis is useful on CM. I prefer to Group Aegis before casting a Channeled block. You can also use manipulations for group aegis.
W5 Soulless Horror - You will be tanking this fight and would definitely appreciate the added toughness. Bring  Signet of Humility for this fight for the additional CC.  Continuum Split has killed many Chrono Tanks in this fight so spatial awareness is important.
W5 Dhuum - You will be tanking this fight and may need to do greens. If you do greens,  Blink will be useful.
W6 Conjured Amalgamate - You can CC multiple shields with  Tides of Time (Shield 5) and  Gravity Well.  Conjured Slash can be duplicated with  Continuum Split but you must click fast.
W6 Twin Largos - This is a very mobile and difficult fight and you can mis-time your wells. However, Chronomancer is one of the best classes to take on either lanes.
W6 Qadim - You have lots of CC options, some of which can be pre-casted for the mini bosses. You will need to tank one of the wyverns. Most of the time you will be bringing  Portal Entre for the split phase and jumping puzzle.
W7 Sabir - With clever use of  Continuum Split, you can generate enough CC to break the bar during the 'coordinated' phase.
W7 Adina - Tank on the grass. Just alternating your three blocks is enough.  Feedback can be duplicated with  Continuum Split and  Mimic. For most groups, a 4th projectile block is not required but in case your options are exhausted,  Phantasmal Warden.  Temporal Curtain (Focus 4) may fail to block projectiles due to height limitations and you will need to sacrifice a trait.
W7 QtP - You will be tanking this fight.
W8 Greer - A reflection variant of this build makes this fight much easier.



 You can overheal using  Relic of the Flock. This generates barrier but has an ICD so you want to spread your casts. ↩


 Using all your shatters in panic without clones will destroy your boon uptime. ↩

Notes

We are also abusing changes to  Inferno to deal damage as part of the boon/healing rotation.  Inferno makes it so that Burning damage you deal scales of Power instead of Condition Damage, and by taking a full set of Harrier's equipment (Power/Healing/Boon Duration), we are maxing out the efficiency of the equipment.

Build



Rotation

Heal Alacrity Tempest follows a fixed rotation. Starting in  Air Attunement, you want to cycle through the elements as shown below.
Elemental Order:


 Water Attunement
 Fire Attunement
 Earth Attunement
 Air Attunement


You should use your skills in the following order in each attunement.
 Air Attunement:


 Lightning Orb (Warhorn 5)
 Cyclone (Warhorn 4)
 Lightning Strike (Scepter 2) (can be skipped)


 Water Attunement:


 Shatterstone (Scepter 2)
 Water Trident (Scepter 3)
 Tidal Surge (Warhorn 4)
 Water Globe (Warhorn 5)
 Water Trident (Scepter 3) (can be skipped)
 Shatterstone (Scepter 2) (can be skipped)


 Fire Attunement:


 Wildfire (Warhorn 5)
 Phoenix (Scepter 3)
 Dragon's Tooth (Scepter 2)
 Heat Sync
 Overload Fire (Warhorn 4)
 Phoenix (Scepter 3)
 Dragon's Tooth (Scepter 2)


 Earth Attunement:


 Dust Storm (Warhorn 5)
 Sand Squall (Warhorn 4)
 Dust Devil (Scepter 3) (can be skipped)
 Overload Earth


Although the rotation may seem daunting with many steps, it can be simplified down to
Simplified Rotation:


 Air Attunement 5 4 2
 Water Attunement 2 3 4 5 3 2
 Fire Attunement 5 3 2 4 Overload 3 2
 Earth Attunement 5 4 3 Overload


Notice that the skills are arranged to be casted mostly from either left to right or right to left. It is actually not critical to cast the skills in each attunement in the specified order, as long as all of them are cast, it will result in very similar results. This means that you can choose to cast all of the skills from left to right or right to left, whichever is more comfortable for you.
Do take note not to accidentally cancel your Overloads as a large part of your boon uptime relies on successfully completing them.
On top of this rotation,
Press off cooldown:


 "Feel the Burn!"
 "Eye of the Storm!"
 "Aftershock!"


 "Feel the Burn!" and  "Eye of the Storm!" have no cast time, and can be used even while overloading.
 "Wash the Pain Away!" and  "Rebound!" are both not used as part of your rotation.  "Wash the Pain Away!" can be used whenever you need additional healing, and  "Rebound!" is your emergency button, and should be your goto button to press whenever you feel a sense of impending doom.
Crowd Control

Your CC skills are
CC Skills:


 Cyclone (Warhorn 4)
 Tidal Surge (Warhorn 4)
 Dust Devil (Scepter 3)
 "Aftershock!"
 Overload Earth


Ensuring that you will almost always have some form of CC available on your bar. Although these are used in your rotation, you can delay your rotation if you know a CC bar is about to happen, as you are mostly overcapping on all of the boons that you provide.
Advanced Tips

After your first loop of rotation, you can delay casting  "Eye of the Storm!" (for Stability/Superspeed) or  "Aftershock!" (for Aegis) if you know there is a mechanic that is about to happen that requires Stability or Aegis.
 
 "Rebound!" can be used to skip certain mechanics to allow your group to have increased damage uptime on the boss. Examples of these mechanics include, but are not limited to, Deimos Mindcrash and Sabir Shockwave.
 
If you are in a fight where lots of condition cleanse is required (i.e Slothasaur), consider swapping  Power Overwhelming for  Smothering Auras, allowing the auras you grant to cleanse conditions as well. This, combined with the number of auras you are constantly granting your allies, will allow you to passively cleanse conditions from your allies.

Build
Heal Alacrity Build



Trait Alternatives

Bring  Master of Consecrations if you are taking consecrations.
Bring  Protector's Restoration if there aren't blockable mechanics.


This build is a simplified version of the heal alacrity build on snowcrows with selective preferences for lower intensity. If you are able to adapt to the version on SC, feel free to follow their guide.

Rotation and Utilities
Heal Alac Rotation

Use your virtues starting from  Rushing Justice (F1) ->  Flowing Resolve (F2) ->  Crashing Courage (F3).
Auto Attack with minimal interruptions, using  "Advance!" can provide the group with permanent swiftness without interrupting your autos.
Use  Flowing Resolve (F2) on cooldown, afterwards use  Rushing Justice (F1)/ Crashing Courage (F3) to reposition.
Use  "Stand Your Ground!" when you require stability.


The importance of your auto attacks cannot be emphasized enough. Your auto attacks heal, provide alacrity, regeneration, might and protection and a field to trigger Relic of Karakosa with!

Burst Heals and Revives

Use  Glacial Blow (Hammer 2) for burst heals (due to Relic of Karakosa). You may refresh this skill using  Banish (Hammer 4).
Use  "Receive the Light!" for a burst heal.
Use  Signet of Mercy as an emergency revive.
Weapon swap to spear

 Symbol of Luminance(Spear 5)
 Solar Storm(Spear 4)
 Gleaming Disc(Spear 3)
 Helio Rush(Spear 2)
 Daybreaking Slash(Spear 1 Auto Attack)
Swap back to hammer when ready



Crowd Control rotation

You have decent CC by just using  Banish (Hammer 4) and  Zealot's Embrace (Hammer 3).
You can extend your CC rotation by starting with  Glacial Blow (Hammer 2) and refreshing it with  Banish (Hammer 4).
If you need more CC you may bring  Sanctuary, which is ideally used in a precast scenario so you can top it up with Hammer 4.

Hybrid DPS

This build does decent DPS.
For low heal-pressure fights, you may bring more power traits to increase your DPS.

Other tips and tricks

You may drop  "Stand Your Ground!" for different utilities.
 Crashing Courage allows you to shadow step through mechanics
Blocking increases your heal power and doing so intelligently allows efficient use of  Invigorated Bulwark

Optimisation
Raid Ready

W1 Gorseval - Immobilise your spirit with  Signet of Wrath and  Zealot's Embrace (Hammer 3)
W1 Sabetha - You can teleport through flame wall with  Crashing Courage.
W2 Slothasor - Bring  Absolute Resolve for additional condition cleanses.
W2 Matthias - Bring  Wall of Reflection for reflects. Bring  Sanctuary if you require more CC.
W3 Escort - This build is able to solo towers albeit a little slow with 6-8k dps. If you want to do the JP, bring  "Feel My Wrath!" for a superspeed boost.
W4 Samarog - You may knock Rigom back with  Banish (Hammer 4) and immobilise with  Zealot's Embrace (Hammer 3) and  Chains of Light (Scepter 3). Bring  Sanctuary if you require more CC.
W4 Deimos - If you are the healer, due to the low toughness, you will probably be tasked to provide group aegis for the other DPS players.
W6 Conjured Amalgamate - Your power DPS can be quite significant despite being a healer. Do not stop attacking with autos. Place  Sanctuary when CA tosses out shields for a precast CC.
W6 Qadim - You want to precast  Sanctuary for each CC phase and load the CC bar with  Banish (Hammer 4) as soon as the minibosses appear.
W7 Sabir - For the final phase if your group needs projectile blocks, consider  Shield of the Avenger and  Wall of Reflection

It is still a bit more challenging than other builds on this site, but if you're interested in picking up special

Build



Handkiting 101
The goal for a handkite is to stay on the opposite site of the platform as the tank (and group),
since the hands spawn at the furthest-away target. The tank will have to move Deimos to avoid oils,
so the handkite will move to continue to be on the opposite side.
In an ideal world, you will want to stack 5 hands in the same spot. But we will just do our best.
It's better to have a messier cluster of hands than to get downed far from the group. If you're having
a hard time with damage, move early.
There are a few things to worry about: Autocasting, Hands, Mind Crush, and Tears. Read on...
Autocasting, Setup
Before the fight, set the following

Autocast (Ctrl-Right Click)  Utility Goggles
Set mech to peaceful to keep it near you.
Warning: avoid targeting Deimos to allow the mech to stay nearby.
The mech will go after your target when you press F2/F3

Staying in a kit will also proc  Backpack Regenerator. I find it helpful to just stay in
 Tool Kit most of the time so I don't accidentally use  Static Shield (Shield 5).
Hands
Almost immediately, Deimos will start spawning hands. They spawn on the furthest player, 5 spawn at a time (every ~1 second), then
there's a short break. Then 5 more, etc. There are several ways to deal with hands:

Facetank hand 1, use  Gear Shield (Tool Kit 4) to block 2 hands, sidestep and dodge the last two.
Facetank hand 1, use  Elixir S for hands 2-4, dodge hand 5.
Warning: if a mind crush happens while Elixir S is active, you cannot block it.
Sidestep/dodge plus outheal with  Elixir H and  Elixir Shell (Mortar Kit 5)

Bonus Healing During Hands

 Elixir Shell creates a water field, use a leap or blast finisher like  Energizing Slam (Mace 2)
or  Magnetic Inversion (double-press Shield 4) for extra healing and barrier from  Chain Reactivity
When off cooldown, press  Crisis Zone (F2) &  Barrier Burst (F3). Because the mech is set to peaceful,
it won't do this on it's own, even if you set them to autocast.

* NOTE: always dodge to the side. You will ideally be on the edge of the platform, so a normal dodge backwards will be fatal.
Mind Crush
Starting very quickly (at 90% health), you will see the first Mind Crush. This is the big explosion that does a lot of damage. Save
 Static Shield (Shield 5) for it. Do not use Shield 5 for anything else.
If you have the ability to listen to audio cues, Saul will call out for people to go to the shield in the center. Handkite should NOT go,
but will use  Static Shield (Shield 5). After the voice line finishes, wait about 1 second, then leave any kit, and pop
the shield.
Additionally, Deimos does the same double handed mace spin animation before mind crush. He'll spin the mace 5 times and then Mind Crush. That
can be used for precise timing.
Tears
These are a relatively minor annoyance, but they do increase damage pressure. Walk into nearby tears during the hand "gap time"

Your rotation consists solely of a priority list of buttons to press.

In an actual fight, there will be many fields placed by your allies that you will be continuously blasting, but on the golem the only fields you have are from  Deploy Jade Sphere and  Flamewall (Focus Fire 4). However, outside of  Phoenix (Scepter Fire 3) and  Dragon's Tooth (Scepter Fire 2), it honestly doesn't matter too much which order you push your buttons in, as long as you try your best to hit them off cooldown.
